TextBlock.TextLine: In Antwerpen 17 July 1681
Brussel meiuffr. Bonnecroy
meinff in antwoort aen den ul van gisteren, segge dat ick de versoghte kanten
moet hebben, saturdagh die komt en 14 dagen voor het alderlanghste dat is
kinen 1ba 17 dagen en aldat dan niet gereet is kan mij iet dienen
want dan met godts gratie hope bij ul te wesen, ende medt te neineiyi
17 July
Brussel Joseph Labberton
ad
Sr. in answer to yd of yeasterday, I want the laces within 14 & 15 dayes
when I hope to see you my self att Brussels I wonder what you say as to
accquainting other people of our dealing, where I am so cautious & shy
that no boddy should know, anything of what wee do toghether for itt 2s not
my intrest, neither & I am confident I never yett have related itt to any
ristiaen soule in the world, on which you may depend whilst I remaine
@ 18 ditto
Lille Rith. Southell
th
Sr. in answer to yd of 16: curitt I can not in large because I am not altogheter
well beeng some what troubled with an agine which hindred mee of sending you
pr last post the inclosed bill on John packett, itt beeng att 15 dayes & acceptad
the 6: curitt thought itt could not be yett due so please to procure the needfulle
beeng glade you had receaved the valew I shall be more large pr. first in the
meane while m. maynard hath engaged him self to provide for serve
one of our news beginners in cloth, which are old traders m stuffs
I have desired him to serve non butt he answer mee that he had engages
his word before he rec. my alter I observe they are to serve every one &
take butt lille notice of common intrest if they prevaile in theirs
wee are extreamly scarey money & all things go verg ill, butt hoped
itt will amend & so remaine
C 18d
Genna 6 mare Ant meschips
In gevolge van tl mestive van 13 & 28 pan is het p paeckenie heden hier erwaght
het tweede tot ceuen al gearriveert hebbe tot d'expeditie de noodigsend gegeens
sal wijders hosn de ord. van Bmonds warner daer mede volgen, as mede
met de gene die, ul op die oft andere manier gper mijn envoij sal seijnden, daer
en tussen, soo hier iyts anders voor valt waer inel can dienen
Bredael Laurens kan
im. Ick hebul brief wel ontfangen, en ick wilde wel dat ick de lakens sagh
soo wel de ul als de mijne, want soude noch geirne met den somer de preuve
neme op dat ick kan sien ofte het oockdennoeyte weeirt is ick sal noch wolle
van Amsterdam doen komen, ende soo ick geen vinde na mijne ham
sal ick u een bale van hier sijnde, want ick hier te veel hebbe sende
heden p voermon floris seltien sulvere durabons die soo aen teekent
ende de naeste weke een briefken van ontfanck boestiert raermede
gent francois Herrebout
monsr. Den ul van J. & 14 deser tsijndertijde ontfangen als mede de goederen
ingeleyt mijnen tol brief voor goederen te komen van brugge verwagh
MN 22 van costij pr schepe, ende PN3 met MN27 van brugge diventerck
aen boort adriaen de keysers, den welken een van mijn tolbrieven gelieft
mede te geven, mij latende weten, soo haest ditto de keyser costij passeirt
@ 19 July
JPr Hhijsbart
Gent
monsr. heb vernegligeert den ul van 12 passato te beantwoorden ondertussch
sijnde legaturen in Englant wel gearriveert tot weijnigh contentement
van mijn correspondent die seght dat de selve meest ongesegelt sijn de
sleght gemaeckt in geleyt remitteere ul ƒ700:- tot laste Jan du cardin
in kent vervalt morgen soo gelieft daer voor het noodigh te besorgen
ende sij soo verre geprotesteert moet worden, laet het geschieden, en
sent hem terugge op dat daer in niet wort versupn ewaer mede blijve
London Abram vivian
th
S. my last to you was on the 12: curitt sence recd. yd of 4th ditto with in voyce
for the bailes N.39 & 40 for which have given you creditt for my halfe share
and haveing examned the pattarnes, do not exspect them to exceed those of
mr. potter, yett when the goods come to hand shall be punctuall in giveing
my opinion, for I am as desirious to be well served as any man living
endeavour that the fine northrens be punctually provided that so wee be not
each ward in assortment of our majaz in here, in which I find (God be thancked)
pretty good sale & much to content in proffitt, as I hope you will also approve
when you see the generall acctt. I know there is boath Richd. pindar & John nelson
att Hull in loading & supose you will divert our risie att zea in boath, and
thought you pretend any thing of my positive order, yett when I write of
shipping, give onely my advise, & leave the menagement of itt wholy to you
where fore pray make no exception up on that acctt. butt endeavour to promote
our intrest on yd side as a sold divert as I do on this side, in which be
confident no endvours are wantino to procure the best, for our advant
I do much want the kersies, so could wish them over: I have yeasterday
opened the 3 bales of bayes in which have found 101 peece according to the inclosed
noted so the differene as 2 p. less then brought to acctt. I never had yett the like
mistake, so hence forward you may no more imploy women in a mans concernes
& pray write about if that itt be rectified for I am give testimonium
of severall that I have imployed in my presence to open these goods: pray
write the needfull about itt I am sorry you do not approve of the small
or narrow ones where as the packetts are so well assorted, as ever any could
butt pray a word how you finde N.16: & principally when you see so different
peoples worck in N.17 & 18, of which shall be glad to have yd opinion inclosed
remittt you 400 W att 56 ¼ is st £ 93:10:10 due the 25 acctt. for which
please to procure the needfull & pass to my acctt beeng on John himcosh london
remaine with kinde saluts
London Henry Mayenard
th
Sr. mij last to you was on the 16: curitt, sence recd. yd of 4h ditto with invoyce of
a bale of white cottons and frises for my half shire in them, have given you
creditt, please to provide 6 or 8 demy cottons white of 25 pence a soad, and gett
them dyed redd of a lively vendarte culour to be sent mee pr. first & as soone
as the reds & spanish are ready lett them come forward, also, I finde goods
extreamly deare & bladd in so much that some cloathes are herdelly vendable
and thought I do my utmost endeavour to gettras much as possible & to dispose
well of the goods, yett you may vere well imagins that itt is impossible
to make thatadvantidge which lasely wee should have, and our anckestors ad
when butt few of a trade, where as now wee finde ware houses in eevery
towne as well att mons: valencienne: Brussels as else where, where
here before never where ny mayat ins & where you nothers have st pu lot
them & thought you supose that providing one will be of no great
conseguence yett stell you that the least that setts up will be preiuditio
tous I wonder whij you s that should engaged yd self tto any
other & give nnce no notue there off if itt was not for yd perticulars
intrest i butt that I rekon not yd intrest neither for yds intrest
is to maintaine trade & not to breake itt which you do if by yd
assistance you bring many or severall in to itt for then wee finde no
sale butt amonghst our selfs, & one underselling the other: & the benesall
coming to little or nothing IK. keepsitt onely to his old freinds, so Did
whnicheste demonterely, butt you, & nntrand all for every boddy
whoesoever: nay randael serves the ver shop heepers thick wat
30„4 serts of goodt te make one pack ott zeems m cals sell
vele at ussels their trade beginisthere befere ours yett
I have sold thes morth the bale N. 20 parter all No. 27 & some mond
spanish ewaths & finde different sale, brutt anextreame
semitie mony pariene onclose remitt £ 59son janus
ver pest of 12 uut 2 aso for yd aitt ett 35:5: I hope in seamey
shall be susamly on cash for mee te pay ges £100: fortny
accn de helft &export ts nupt mooes tollowangh poste
whenyonu comtover you know yd bodging
